results.title: Uncle
results.creator_credit: Adam Elliot, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: An unnamed child, present only by an adult voice-over recounts the life of his uncle. How he survives his wife’s death, his dog’s death, and eventually his own inevitable end. The childlike innocence of the reflection is juxtaposed by the adult narration. Narrated by William McInnes and featuring John Flaus as the Uncle. The story is portrayed through animated clay figures. This film forms part of the autobiographical trilogy that includes “Uncle”, “Brother” and “Cousin”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Elliot, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts

results.title: Unbroken Spirit
results.creator_credit: George Gittoes and Gittoes and Dalton Productions
results.brief_description: The Tapp brothers of Kilarni Station, in the Northern Territory, and other stockmen talk about their way of life out in the bush mustering wild cattle.

results.title: Unbreakable [DVD]
results.creator_credit: M Night Shyamalan, Barry Mendel, Sam Mercer, Blinding Edge Pictures, Limited Edition Productions Inc. and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Unbreakable is the follow-up film for M. Night Shyamalan after his worldwide hit “The Sixth sense”. Bruce Willis stars as David Dunn, an everyman character, a security guard and father of one, whose marriage is undergoing a crisis. David is the only survivor of a horrific train crash and miraculously is completely unharmed. Just after the crash David is befriended by Elijah Price aka Mr Glass (Samuel L. Jackson), a man suffering from the opposite syndrome - he is as fragile as cotton wool and has spent his entire life recovering from broken bones. Price runs a comic book store specialising in original comic book cells and has a genuine belief that superheroes exist in real life. These two men of opposing physical make-ups are brought together and discover that their destinies are strangely linked. David slowly comes to realise that he has extrasensory powers and superhuman strength that render him unbreakable. “Unbreakable” is a thriller, a classic good versus evil tale that explores the notion of supernatural forces at work in the world. Cast also includes Robin Wright Penn.

results.title: Una Domenica d'Agosto = A Sunday in August
results.creator_credit: Luciano Emmer, Sergio Amidei and Colonna Film
results.brief_description:
A comedy-drama exploring the diverse social stratas in 1950s Italy as an unrelated group of people travel to Ostia Beach to escape Rome’s heat. During the course of the day their relationships are observed and their aspirations and destinies gradually revealed. Made on location in a Neo-Realist vein, using a partly amateur cast.

Credits: Producer, Sergio Amidei ; director, Luciano Emmer ; writer, Franco Brusati, Luciano Emmer, Cesare Zavattini, Giulio Macchi ; photography, Domenica Scala, Leonida Barboni, Ubaldo Marelli ; editing, Jolanda Benvenuti ; music, Roman Vlad.
Cast: Anna Baldini, Franco Interlenghi, Marcello Mastroianni, Elvy Lissia, Massimo Serato, Correda Verga, Ave Ninchi.

results.title: Ulzana's raid [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Carter de haven and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: In this brutal western, directed by Robert Aldrich, the central relationship is between an idealistic and inexperienced young officer and a world-weary veteran scout. They are sent on a mission to pursue a small group of Chiricahua Apaches who have broken out of the reservation. One of several westerns of the sixties and seventies which seem to have been made with the Vietnam War in mind, it is also one of the few westerns to attempt to unravel cause and effect, representing the Indian neither as merely hostile nor as the noble savage. Cast: Burt Lancaster, Bruce Davison, Jorge Luke, Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: Uluru
results.brief_description: In this avant-garde videofilm by Michael Glasheen time lapse photography, superimposition’s and video mixing are used to relate Aboriginal myths such as Wanambi, the rainbow serpent, to the topography of Ayers Rock.

results.title: Ultra vires
results.creator_credit: Emma Kelly, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: A 2-d hand-drawn animation about a young woman who fights off the attacks of a fierce dragon. Before the woman kills the dragon with her sword the dragon manages to make his slow but fatal blow. No dialogue but music performed by Peter Tumble, James Wilkinson and Gareth Skinner.

results.title: Ulster heritage
results.creator_credit: Stanley Willis, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: From the story of one family and one farm in Northern Ireland, a colorful and impressive picture of a modern farming community emerges, giving incidental glimpses of Ulster as a highly modern industrialised province and a place of considerable scenic attractions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Willis, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions

results.title: Ulster
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scenic and sporting attractions of Northern Ireland and records, in particular, sequences from recent Tourist Trophy motor and Grand Prix motor-cycle events (featuring Stirling Moss). The film includes a visit to Belfast, capital of Northern Ireland; scenic attractions among the mountain and lake country; a visit to Carlingford Lough and the Silent Valley; a drive through the Glen of Antrim to Portrush, famous for its swimming, sailing and its golf course.

results.title: UK Prime Minister in Africa
results.brief_description: Scenes from Mr Harold MacMillan’s tour of Africa in the spring of 1960. Accompanied by Lady Dorothy MacMillan, the Prime Minister visits Ghana, Nigeria and the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland, witnessing both the spectacular material progress in these quickly developing territories and the friendliness and goodwill which have not been affected by the achievement of the prospect of independence.
